oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Regulation
Values, standards and certification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Chinese farming is likely to remain different from Europeâ€™s. Driven by globalization, however, a worldwide trend of harmonization of agricultural market and production systems also affects China. This global trend includes growth of certified organic agriculture.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kledal, Paul; Yu, Qiao; Egelyng, Henrik; Yunguan, Xi; Halberg, Niels and Xianjun, L (2007) Organic Food and Farming in China. In: Willer, Helga and Yussefi, (Eds.) The World of Organic Agriculture: Statistics and Emerging Trends. Fibl, chapter 13, pp. 114-119.
